fields.customfield_17901: Issue: When passport # and COI are entered, then saved and viewed on Confirmation page - then the user goes Back, removes Passport # which then removes the COI, and user saves and continues, the COI is still on the Confirmation page. fields.description: As a General User or Supervisor User I need to have a confirmation screen so that I can review what I have entered

comments.body:
Technical details / tasks:
* Retain data (first from initiate case page, pass data back to initiate case page when hitting the back button)
* Data fields on confirmation page are read only

Est Medium size

Task: React component that passes information that passes to a new component in a read-only manner
Task: Apply Styles: use Erland's approach to organize style in React
Use Native Bootstrap styles, limit custom CSS

*Note: Layout of fields may change. Be flexible as possible.

Estimated points: Medium Plus

508 Violation:
- Page needs a title attribute

work remaining to be done:
- I-94 alien number issue
- 508 fix
- title card for additional requests shows even when 
back button does not auto populate the initiate case screen.

third bullet correction from prior comment:
- title card should not display when additional requests are not present.
- back button goes all the way back to login that is why it isn't populating.

Issue: When passport # and COI are entered, then saved and viewed on Confirmation page - then the user goes Back, removes Passport # which then removes the COI, and user saves and continues, the COI is still on the Confirmation page. The COI should not be there (same as passport # is no longer there). Sent back to In Progress.

fields.description:
When a verification returns a status response, what data fields are returned? What can we display to the user?

SM-113 and SM-76 are dependent on this research

Output of this spike: 
List of all status response fields
What logic is run before the stored procedures are run? Done
What logic is run after the stored procedures return? Done

Tasks: 
Sample data in the database table
Trace through the business logic - create wiki

1.5 days - to find response fields
fields.summary: Research - What is returned in a Non-IAV Response and an IAV Response

Run through all scenarios

Given the <user> is on the Confirmation Screen
And the <user> has entered an I-94 Number
And the <user> has entered an Document Description 
And the <user> has entered First Name, Last Name, and Birth date
When the <user> clicks Initiate Verification
Then the system passes in document type ID as Other
And the system initiates verification

Given the <user> has Initiated Verification
When the system has verified the information
And has found a status
Then the system displays the status result screen

See Zeplin for the screen design

Tasks:
- Show status result in full UI Design (see Zeplin for design)
- Doesn't include Removal Order
- Doesn't include case queuing
- Doesn't include additional requests

Notes from previous conversation:
Tasks:
*Relevant procedures (per Rama) for discussion: 
*Create Initial Case
*ProcessNonSevisCaseVerification
*ProcessSevisCaseVerification
*GetGrantDateOrder
*SendCaseNotification to SVS

calls to stored procedures
*Create Initial Case - done, 8
*Process Agency Case Information - 13
*Agency Preliminary Additional - CPS_CASE_INTERFACE_PKG.CPS_AGENCY_PRIM_ADDIT_V2_SP - 8
    
ESB calls
n/a

Java/business Logic
*I-94 vs A# - This story is only for I-94
*Method for selection logic  ~13

Rails
*Post (exists already) 
*Validate input parameters - 3-5 

React - 21
*Need to know what information we keep
*Build status results screen UI
*Determine success or error mapping
*Interpret error messages coming back
*Includes field labels
**Will not include field order, and fields are determined by response (not design)

fields.customfield_17901:
Flow for I-94 only search:
•    Has an I-94 number
•    Has a first and last name
•    no existing case number (true initial verification - no existing case)
•    no a-number
•    no sevis id
•    no passport number
•    no visa number
*   not queuing

Start: 
=> InitConfirm.ascx (user control for the confirmation page): user presses the next/submit button
=> IVWizard.ConfirmNext_Click event
=> InitVerificationBusiness.ExecInitVerReq45
=> CasesData.ExecInitVerReq45
=> does audit stuff
=> CasesData.ValidateInputByAgencyTransactionNumber
       => CPS_CASE_INTERFACE_PKG.CPS_VAL_INPUT_BY_AGY_TRN_CD_SP
=> CasesData.ExecuteInitialVerification
       => more audit stuff
       => CPS_CASE_INTERFACE_PKG.CPS_EXEC_INIT_VERIF_V2_SP

=> No alien number so skip EADS check
=> Not a resubmit so Loop Through Benefits
    For each Benefit in BenefitList 
     ExecStdFedQryBenefits(initVerInfo.VerificationNumber, drBenefit["BENEFIT_CODE"].ToString(), initVerInfo.LogonID, tableName);
        "cps_case_interface_pkg.CPS_ADD_BENEFIT_SP”
fields.description: As a <user> when I submit applicant details I will see a screen with a status found and in non-IAV status.
fields.summary: I-94 Verification, Doc Descr (Result Screen- status)

comments.body: there is a table in VIS called CPS_NIIS that will have I94s that will result in a match we can use this for sample data.

- We could have an indicator for submitted vs. response data coming back from the Java layer. 
- whether you have a match or not comes back from the business logic, so it can be handled on the front end entirely.
- rails API is a pass through as far as the JSON returned is concerned, objects can be created to handle the way a request will be made
- we will not be performing the request additional verification call, we will redirect to the legacy code in whatever endpoint is easiest to hit. 
- notes on the design document to explain how the page will handle varied responses.

Flow for I-94 only search:
•    Has an I-94 number
•    Has a first and last name
•    no existing case number (true initial verification - no existing case)
•    no a-number
•    no sevis id
•    no passport number
•    no visa number
*   not queuing

Start: 
=> InitConfirm.ascx (user control for the confirmation page): user presses the next/submit button
=> IVWizard.ConfirmNext_Click event
=> InitVerificationBusiness.ExecInitVerReq45
=> CasesData.ExecInitVerReq45
=> does audit stuff
=> CasesData.ValidateInputByAgencyTransactionNumber
       => CPS_CASE_INTERFACE_PKG.CPS_VAL_INPUT_BY_AGY_TRN_CD_SP
=> CasesData.ExecuteInitialVerification
       => more audit stuff
       => CPS_CASE_INTERFACE_PKG.CPS_EXEC_INIT_VERIF_V2_SP

=> No alien number so skip EADS check
=> Not a resubmit so Loop Through Benefits
    For each Benefit in BenefitList 
     ExecStdFedQryBenefits(initVerInfo.VerificationNumber, drBenefit["BENEFIT_CODE"].ToString(), initVerInfo.LogonID, tableName);
        "cps_case_interface_pkg.CPS_ADD_BENEFIT_SP”

fields.customfield_17901:
Outcome of the spike and discussions with VariQ

Harrison: we set up an Elasticache in AWS, which VariQ was able to access.  They added a key-value pair, and sent over the key.  We then accessed it from over here, and were able to retrieve the value they stored, proving that we can a) spin up, b) share, and c) delete information on a shared Redis cache.

Dan: Encryption is actually a settled issue, since there’s a good bit of prior art in this area.  Encryption will be an RSA keypair provided by DHS (same as all our other encryption).  The entire payload will be encrypted, so the whole hash of { “user_id”: “abc123” } will be encrypted (rather than just the value of each keypair).  We will provide the VIS team with the public key and we’ll retain the private key on our side for decryption.  And a lesson learned here, the keypair we use for Stage will need to be a production keypair rather than nonprod, since Stage is considered a production environment on the VIS side.  

As far as the key for the redis cache entry, we’re recommending a 16-bit secure-random hex token or a secure-random GUID (the specific implementation is up to VariQ, it doesn’t matter to us).
fields.description:
Proof of concept with VariQ for session sharing
Determine if VariQ can connect to the cache

Timebox: 3 days, 2 developers

comments.body:
Outcome of the spike and discussions with VariQ

Harrison: we set up an Elasticache in AWS, which VariQ was able to access.  They added a key-value pair, and sent over the key.  We then accessed it from over here, and were able to retrieve the value they stored, proving that we can a) spin up, b) share, and c) delete information on a shared Redis cache.

Dan: Encryption is actually a settled issue, since there’s a good bit of prior art in this area.  Encryption will be an RSA keypair provided by DHS (same as all our other encryption).  The entire payload will be encrypted, so the whole hash of { “user_id”: “abc123” } will be encrypted (rather than just the value of each keypair).  We will provide the VIS team with the public key and we’ll retain the private key on our side for decryption.  And a lesson learned here, the keypair we use for Stage will need to be a production keypair rather than nonprod, since Stage is considered a production environment on the VIS side.  

As far as the key for the redis cache entry, we’re recommending a 16-bit secure-random hex token or a secure-random GUID (the specific implementation is up to VariQ, it doesn’t matter to us).

fields.customfield_13430:
SECTION 4 DESIGN & IMPLEMENTATION (COMPLETE IF CR INCLUDES INFRASTRUCTURE CHANGES)

If the CR involves any infrastructure changes, such as VM, database, migration, or changes to any of the other fields listed in Section 4 for any environment, then Section 4 must be filled out in its entirety. The purpose of Section 4 is to capture the necessary information and requirements needed by the ESDO Infrastructure team and the data center support personnel required to install, connect and configure the infrastructure and services in the Enterprise Data Centers in support of ESDO projects.
fields.customfield_12100:
Given the user is logged into the system
When the user views a screen where checkbox values are present
Then the system displays styled checkboxes

Given the user is on the Initiate Details screen
When the user has not selected at least one Requested Benefit
Then the system does not enable the Save and Continue button

Tasks:
*Create a reusable component for checkboxes (See styling in zeplin)
*Validation on Checkboxes (currently necessary for Requested Benefits on initiate case details screen) At least one requested benefit must be selected for the user to continue, the user may select one or more

Example: https://app.zeplin.io/project.html#pid=589120e99f075d89446fc351&sid=5891fb72c4a8fbc05126792f

fields.customfield_17901:
Per Chris Lyon:
We should disable the continue button if there are no required benefits checked

comments.body:
additional refactor tasks:
change checkbox functionality to update set value on state object instead of adding to new array of checked options
create new java endpoint to return only the additional indicators since we don't need additional fields anymore. (shouldn't edit old one because why erase existing functioanlity) (we are currently filtering teh results of this call in react FirstStep.getDocumentData method but should add new java endpoint for it

Checkboxes have been refactored to each represent an object. They are controlled by that object's .value attr being set to 'checked' or not, and - in FirstStep at least - modify that property onChange (when checked by user).

In FirstStep we now modify the objects in place, updating the value. For validation, should use either state or (for validation error rules) use rule: 's second arg of all the components in the form to determine objects that are required, either or, etc and validate accordingly.

Per Chris Lyon:
We should disable the continue button if there are no required benefits checked
